analytic.title: To his selected Friend, Mr. IAMES HAYWARD upon his Translation of EROMENA.

monogr.title: Eromena, or, Love and revenge. Written originally in the Thoscan tongue, by Cavalier Gio. Francesco Biondi, Gentleman extraordinary of his Majesties Privie Chamber. Divided into six books. And now faithfully Englished, by Ia. Hayvvard, of Graies-Inne Gent
monogr.author: Biondi, Giovanni Francesco, Sir

keywords.term: Dictionaries, vocabularies, phrase books, instruction in foreign languages

div.head: To his selected Friend, Mr. IAMES HAYWARD upon his Translation of EROMENA.
div.l: WHat? laid aside thy Compasse? from whose use
No Art could wean thee or thy constant Muse?
Or with the Circle art thou fallen at Square?
Lines want their due imployment, that I see
No, th'are thy Passatempos fruits, and they
Tasted by a judicious palat may
Have a good relish, and deserve (though so)
More praise than a more serious piece, and moe
Than Ile conferre upon thee; yet I owe
Something unto thy gratefulnesse, that thou,
Bin polisht to the choisest Thoscan stile,
Hast in the way of friendly commutation,
Taught her the language of our English nation.
